titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I returned to Dean's Yard after taking part for the last time in an election to the All Souls Fellowships. Yesterday we elected Raymond Asquith and Gwyer, both law candidates.
I went to Horley in order to satisfy myself that Mother & Marion were satisfactorily placed. They seemed happy.
After dinner I held a meeting of the S. Paul's Guild. One new member appeared.
Herbert Francis Cox. 21 years old, he works at Gorringe's. 55 Buckingham Palace Road.
